alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Sitka (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 12:17PM AKST until March 01 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW LIKELY STARTING TUESDAY NIGHT THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT... A rapidly strengthening low will develop in the Gulf of Alaska during the day on Tuesday. This low is expected to move towards the northern gulf coast before stalling out during the day on Wednesday. Snow will begin in the Yakutat area before extending to the south during the overnight hours of Tuesday night into the day on Wednesday. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals for the southern half of the panhandle as southerly flow may cause a mix with or complete change to rain Wednesday afternoon and evening. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Sitka. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon AKST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to mix or change to rain midday Wednesday.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.
